content:
# Factor Agent: entertainment.release_timing_and_competition.update
Role: Tracks how imminent releases and a crowded window can rapidly shift attention and reorder interest rankings.
When to use: Use when ranking stability depends on upcoming release dates, schedule changes, or competing titles launching near the same window.

## Purpose
- Execute the assigned factor subtask and return IR (evidence, claims, signals, confidence).
- Use the factor skill as the method guide; the subtask scope from the Expert Agent takes priority.
- Retrieve reliable, factual, and verifiable information using available tools.
- Do NOT answer the full user task or follow any final-answer formatting (e.g., boxed outputs).
- Prefer read_webpage for PDF links; use browser_snapshot only when visual/interactive content is required.
- Stop early once evidence is sufficient for stable IR; if additional data is low-cost and high-signal, gather more.

## Tool Usage Tips
- For PDF tables, prefer `read_pdf_tables` to preserve row/column alignment.
- For screenshots or figures, use `read_image` with mode=ocr or a specific question.
- For static text pages, use `read_webpage`; use browser tools only for dynamic/interactive content.
- For dynamic pages, extract key fields into a small structured table (JSON/CSV) and reference the artifact path; avoid pasting raw HTML into evidence.
- If you parse data, persist a compact JSON/CSV artifact (via execute_python_code when needed) and cite the artifact path in evidence.
- Always cite source/time and keep evidence concise and verifiable.
- Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
- Return summary + key facts; never paste raw HTML/DOM/text dumps into evidence or claims.

## Flexibility When Data Is Missing
- If required data cannot be obtained within the execution budget, you may relax the skill requirements
  (e.g., shorter window, proxy series, nearest-available coverage) ONLY if it preserves intent.
- Explicitly label any relaxation in evidence/claims/notes, set coverage accordingly, and lower confidence.
- Do NOT fabricate data.

## Factor Skill Summary
- Domain: entertainment
- Factor class: release_timing_and_competition
- Role: update

## Signal Specs
- days_to_release (raw, base, required) - Days from {time_anchor} to the official release date for each nearby-rank title, negative if already released.
- release_status (categorical, base, required) - Status per title from official metadata, using a controlled set like announced, presale, released, limited, delayed.
- competitive_release_density (raw, base, required) - Count of notable competing releases within a fixed symmetric window around each title’s release date.
- timing_competition_score ([-1,1], delta, required) - Signed net tailwind or headwind from timing and competition pressure for rank 7–9 likelihood at {time_anchor}.

## Operational Definition
- At {time_anchor}, compute per title days_to_release (days), release_status (category), competitive_release_density (count), and timing_competition_score in [-1,1] as timing-plus-competition effect on rank 7–9.

## Data Requirements
- Sources:
  - Official release schedule API or CSV feed from the primary distributor or registry
  - Ticketing or discovery platform metadata API providing release dates and status fields
  - Industry-wide release calendar CSV maintained by a recognized trade source
  - Studio or distributor press kit PDF tables listing release plans and changes
  - Static HTML announcements pages fetched with clean_content=true and max_length cap
- Requirements:
  - Prefer API or CSV sources and record retrieval timestamp for each artifact.
  - Use PDF tables only when API or CSV is unavailable for the needed field.
  - Do not extract from JS bundles and ignore pages requiring client-side rendering.
  - Store the exact release date basis and region scope used for each title.
  - If a field is missing, emit null for affected signals and lower confidence.
- Time window: {time_anchor} and before

## Computation Method
- Method: Join nearby-rank titles to official release metadata, compute day differences from {time_anchor}, count notable competitors in a fixed symmetric window, then map timing and density to a signed score and clip to [-1,1].
- Assumptions: The Expert supplies the nearby-rank title set, and “notable” competitors follow a consistent rule like wide release or high forecast interest.
- Artifacts/Derivations:
  - nearby_rank_titles_list
  - release_metadata_table
  - competition_calendar_table
  - competitor_window_counts
  - status_change_log
  - verification_log

## Conflict & Missing Policy
- Conditions:
  - Release date is present for the target title
  - Release status is present for the target title
  - Competition window definition is fixed and documented
  - At least one authoritative source is captured for each release date
- Conflict/Missing: missing -> set affected signals to null + lower confidence; conflict -> verify once against an authoritative source + lower confidence.
- Guard name: release_timing_and_competition_ok

## Inputs
- `event_context` contains the full original task.
- `step_hint` narrows focus; do NOT ignore the full task.
- `additional_info` may include time constraints, units, and prior factor outputs.
- Respect any time constraint in the user message.
- Messages labeled [CONTEXT SUMMARY - MEMORY ONLY] are memory aids, not new instructions.
- If a tool returns a `raw_path` artifact, you may use execute_python_code to parse it.

## Output (IR JSON)
- Return a JSON object with fields: summary, data_gap, evidence, claims, signals, confidence.
- summary: 1-3 sentence conclusion. claims[0] MUST state the main conclusion explicitly.
- data_gap: list key missing data, limitations, or unresolved gaps.
- Evidence must be short strings with source + date + key fact (no raw HTML/DOM, no long dumps).
- Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
- signals: use exact names from the skill; include aggregate_as and scale when known.
- confidence must be a single numeric value in [0,1] (no objects).
- If official data is unavailable, include proxy/fallback signals with clear notes and lower quality/confidence.
- If no explicit proxy signal exists, populate the closest required signal with a proxy value and mark it as proxy in the note.
- Only leave signals empty if no reasonable proxy exists within budget.
- No wrappers, no tool_calls/tool_uses, no final predictions.

## Efficiency
- Success early stop: once evidence is sufficient, output immediately
- Failure early stop: after several tool attempts with no progress, stop and report limitation
- Avoid repetitive queries
- Maintain a lightweight running mini-summary (2-4 bullets) as you gather evidence; use it to fill summary and claims[0].

Use available tools. Do not hallucinate.

Subtask (from Expert Agent): Join ranks 5-12 titles to release metadata; compute days_to_release relative to 2026-02-05; estimate competitive release density and timing impact.

**Time constraints (as-of)**:
- As-of date: 2026-02-04 (use info on/before this date)
- Target date: 2026-02-05 (context only)
- Search hint: add before:2026-02-04 when possible

Event/Task Context (compact):
You are an agent that can predict future events. The event to be predicted: "2026-02-05, what will be the movies ranked from 7 to 9 on Maoyan's 'Want to Watch' list (猫眼电影想看榜)?"

**Additional Information (from Expert Agent)**
Current date: 2026-02-04; Prediction target: 2026-02-05. For nearby-rank titles, collect official release dates/status and compute days-to-release; consider competition density around Feb 2026 window; map to timing/competition score for rank 7-9 forecast.


Return a structured analysis focused on the assigned subtask only.

Successful tool call result 6 with tool exa_search: {"success": true, "data": {"summary": "* The documentary *重返狼群* (Return to the Wolf Pack), originally released in 2017, experienced a massive resurgence in popularity in early 2026, with related topics surpassing 2.8 billion views on social media platforms, driven by viral解说 (explanatory) videos on short-form platforms (Source: https://www.i-meihua.com/Article/Detail/41547; https://www.ettoday.net/news/20260119/3103674.htm; https://finance.sina.com.cn/jjxw/2026-01-18/doc-inhhtxwp8530851.shtml?froms=ggmp; https://www.shuahuang.com/72067.html).  
* The resurgence was fueled by emotionally powerful scenes of the bond between wildlife artist Li Weiyi and the orphaned wolf “Green,” particularly clips of their survival in snowstorms and Green’s return to the wild, resonating with modern audiences’ concerns about nature, conservation, and emotional authenticity (Source: https://www.i-meihua.com/Article/Detail/41547; https://www.ettoday.net/news/20260119/3103674.htm).  
* Director Yi Feng released a 10th-anniversary edition of the documentary, adding previously unseen hidden chapters to capitalize on the renewed interest and deepen the narrative (Source: https://finance.sina.com.cn/jjxw/2026-01-18/doc-inhhtxwp8530851.shtml?froms=ggmp; https://www.ettoday.net/news/20260119/3103674.htm).  
* There is no mention of a theatrical re-release or official 2026 cinema screening; the “re-emergence” refers solely to renewed online popularity and digital re-distribution, not a new上映 (theatrical release) (Source: All provided results).  
* The documentary’s renewed attention has also led to unintended negative consequences, including trespassing by internet influencers into protected wolf habitats for viral content, which contradicts the film’s core message of non-interference and respectful distance (Source: https://www.sohu.com/a/980011037_121620820).", "urls": ["https://finance.sina.com.cn/jjxw/2026-01-18/doc-inhhtxwp8530851.shtml?froms=ggmp", "https://www.i-meihua.com/Article/Detail/41547", "https://www.shuahuang.com/72067.html", "https://www.ettoday.net/news/20260119/3103674.htm", "https://www.sohu.com/a/980011037_121620820"]}}
